title: SalivaDirect: RNA extraction-free SARS-CoV-2 diagnostics

creator.name: Nathan Grubaugh
creator.affiliation: Department of Epidemiology of Microbial Diseases, Yale School of Public Health

source.description:
Saliva can either be collected independently by the individual providing the sample ('Self-collection') or with the assistance of a healthcare worker ('Assisted'). Alternatively, a
saliva collection aid
can be used.

cases.title: Self-collection
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"alnc0","text":"For independent collection of sample by the individual providing the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Assisted collection
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ck4gn","text":"For collection of saliva by a healthcare worker or technician ('sample collector'). The ‘sample provider’ is the individual providing saliva and may include patients, individuals undergoing screening, or research study participants.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

source.description: Before collection, clean hands using alcohol-based sanitizer or soap and water (no fragrances).
Ensure all collection materials are labelled with the correct identifying information.

While preparing collection materials, begin pooling saliva in your mouth. Saliva production can be stimulated by thinking about food (favorite foods, upcoming meals, etc.) or about the saliva collection itself. Thinking about this while preparing to collect the sample can help ensure enough can be pooled in the mouth quickly and easily.

source.body:
This protocol is intended for the collection of the normal saliva that naturally pools into the mouth. No coughing or sniffing prior to sample collection is required.
Ideally, water should be avoided 10 minutes prior to collection. Other drinks, food, and nasal sprays should be avoided for half an hour before sample collection.

source.description: Remove the lid of the collection container and gently expel saliva into the collection tube until at least 0.5 mL has been collected.

source.body: The total volume measured is to exclude any bubbles.

source.description: Once at least 0.5 mL has been collected, securely replace the lid of the collection container.
Following collection, clean hands using alcohol-based sanitizer or soap and water, and sterilize the collection tube with 70% ethanol or a disinfecting wipe.
Register the sample collection (including date and time), and place the sample in a secondary container or biohazard bag with a biohazard label.
Transfer the sample at room temperature to the laboratory for sample processing. The virus RNA in saliva remains stable at room temperature for 3-5 days.
Store samples at 2-8°C until sample transport or processing (up to 72 hours). If longer-term storage is required, samples can be kept at -20°C for 2-4 weeks, or at -80°C for longer term storage.

Add Proteinase K (see table for volume per sample) to designated 8-strip PCR tubes (200 µL capacity).
ABC
1VendorConcentrationVolume
2ThermoFisher Scientific MagMAX™ Viral/Pathogen Proteinase K50 mg/mL2.5 µL
3New England Biolabs Proteinase K, Molecular Biology Grade20 mg/mL6.25 µL
4AmericanBio Proteinase KLyophilized (add 50 mg per 1 mL of nuclease-free water) 2.5 µL

ABC
1VendorConcentrationVolume
2ThermoFisher Scientific MagMAX™ Viral/Pathogen Proteinase K50 mg/mL2.5 µL
3New England Biolabs Proteinase K, Molecular Biology Grade20 mg/mL6.25 µL
4AmericanBio Proteinase KLyophilized (add 50 mg per 1 mL of nuclease-free water) 2.5 µL

source.body: This work should be completed under BSL-2 conditions, and samples potentially containing SARS-CoV-2 should only be handled in a biosafety cabinet. Please seek guidance from your local biosafety office on specific recommendations for working with samples which could contain SARS-CoV-2.

source.description: Vortex each saliva sample until homogeneous, and immediately transfer 50 µL saliva to each 8-strip PCR tube containing proteinase K.
Close the 8-strip tube lids tightly.
Place the 8-strip tubes in a rack and vortex for 1 minute at 3000-5000 RPM.
Briefly spin down the rack/tubes using a plate spinner or 8-strip tube microcentrifuge.

source.body: If no plate centrifuge or spinner is available, the plate can be gently tapped to get the samples at the bottom of each well.

source.description: Inactivate the proteinase K by heating samples for 5 minutes at 95°C on a PCR instrument or equivalent thermocycler.
Briefly spin down the tubes using a plate spinner or 8-strip tube microcentrifuge.
Store samples at -80°C or proceed immediately to RT-qPCR testing.
Prepare 20 uM working stocks of the primers and probes (sequences provided in Materials) by adding 20 µL of 100 uM stock to 80 µL nuclease-free water.

source.body:
Briefly vortex and centrifuge reagents before use.
Probes are photosensitive and should be stored in the dark.

source.description:
Use the 20 uM working stocks to prepare dualplex primer-probe-water mix containing the following:
ABC
1ComponentVolume (1 reaction) Volume (100 reactions)
22019-nCoV_N1-F (400 nM/reaction)0.4 µL40 µL
32019-nCoV_N1-R (400 nM/reaction)0.4 µL40 µL
42019-nCoV_N1-P (200 nM/reaction)0.2 µL20 µL
5RP-F (150 nM/reaction)0.15 µL15 µL
6RP-R (150 nM/reaction)0.15 µL15 µL
7RP-P (200 nM/reaction)0.2 µL20 µL
8Nuclease-free water2.5 µL250 µL

ABC
1ComponentVolume (1 reaction) Volume (100 reactions)
22019-nCoV_N1-F (400 nM/reaction)0.4 µL40 µL
32019-nCoV_N1-R (400 nM/reaction)0.4 µL40 µL
42019-nCoV_N1-P (200 nM/reaction)0.2 µL20 µL
5RP-F (150 nM/reaction)0.15 µL15 µL
6RP-R (150 nM/reaction)0.15 µL15 µL
7RP-P (200 nM/reaction)0.2 µL20 µL
8Nuclease-free water2.5 µL250 µL

On ice, prepare a master mix containing the following (account for 10% extra lost during pipetting).
ABCD
1ComponentNEB LunaBio-Rad RelianceThermo TaqPath
2Master mix10 µL5 µL5 µL
3RT1 µL--
4Primer-probe-water mix (see above)4 µL4 µL4 µL
5Nuclease-free water-6 µL6 µL

source.body: Briefly vortex and centrifuge reagents before use.

source.description:
ABCD
1ComponentNEB LunaBio-Rad RelianceThermo TaqPath
2Master mix10 µL5 µL5 µL
3RT1 µL--
4Primer-probe-water mix (see above)4 µL4 µL4 µL
5Nuclease-free water-6 µL6 µL
Place the 96-well PCR plate on the PCR plate cooler, and add 15 µL of mastermix to each designated well.
Bring the processed samples and the PCR mastermix plate to a biosafety cabinet.

source.body: Most institutions will require samples potentially containing full-length SARS-CoV-2 RNA to be handled in a biosafety cabinet. Please seek guidance from your local biosafety office on specific recommendations for working with samples which could contain full-length SARS-CoV-2 RNA.

source.description: Add 5 µL of extraction-free saliva sample to each well of the mastermix plate. Mix by pipetting, taking care to avoid introducing bubbles.

source.body: Extraction-free saliva samples can be added using a multichannel pipette for high-throughput testing.

source.description:
Add 5 µL of positive control (
Twist synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA controls
at 100 copies/uL) and no-template control (NTC - water) to each designated PCR well. Mix by pipetting, taking care to avoid introducing bubbles.
Seal with a transparent plastic qPCR seal. Centrifuge briefly to remove bubbles, if present.

Load the plate into the qPCR machine, and run the following thermocycler conditions:
ABC
1StepTemperatureTime
2152°C10 min
3295°C 2 min
4395°C 10 sec
5455°C 30 sec
65Read plate
7Repeat steps 3-5 for 44 cycles.

ABC
1StepTemperatureTime
2152°C10 min
3295°C 2 min
4395°C 10 sec
5455°C 30 sec
65Read plate
7Repeat steps 3-5 for 44 cycles.

Report results per the following criteria:
ABCD
1OutputSignificanceRP CTN1 CT
20Negative<35>40
31Invalid>35>40
42Positiveany value<40

ABCD
1OutputSignificanceRP CTN1 CT
20Negative<35>40
31Invalid>35>40
42Positiveany value<40
The sample collector must don PPE (at minimum, mask and gloves) prior to contact with the sample provider.
The sample provider must clean their hands using alcohol-based sanitizer or soap and water (no fragrances).
The sample collector should verify all collection material labeling (at minimum, patient name/identifier and date of collection) with the sample provider.
While preparing collection materials, direct the participant to begin pooling saliva in their mouth. Saliva production can be stimulated by thinking about food (favorite foods, upcoming meals, etc.)

source.body:
This protocol is intended for the collection of the normal saliva that naturally pools into the mouth. No coughing or sniffing prior to sample collection is required.
Ideally, water should be avoided 10 minutes prior to collection. Other drinks, food, and nasal sprays should be avoided for half an hour before sample collection.

source.description: The sample collector will give the collection container to the sample provider.
The sample provider will remove the lid of the collection container and gently expel saliva into the collection tube until at least 0.5 mL has been collected.

source.body: The total volume measured should exclude any bubbles.

source.description: Once at least 0.5 mL has been collected, the sample provider will securely replace the lid of the collection container.

Following collection, the sample provider should again clean their hands using alcohol-based sanitizer or soap and water. The sample collector will sterilize the collection tube with 70% ethanol or a disinfecting wipe.
The sample collector will register the sample collection, and place the sample in a secondary container or a biohazard bag with a biohazard label.
The sample collector will transfer samples at room temperature to the laboratory for sample processing. The virus RNA in saliva remains stable at room temperature for 3-5 days.

Store samples in the laboratory at 2-8°C until sample transport or processing (up to 72 hours). If longer-term storage is required, samples can be kept at -20°C for 2-4 weeks, or at -80°C for longer term storage.

Add Proteinase K (see table for volume per sample) to designated 8-strip PCR tubes (200 µL capacity).
ABC
1VendorConcentrationVolume
2ThermoFisher Scientific MagMAX™ Viral/Pathogen Proteinase K50 mg/mL2.5 µL
3New England Biolabs Proteinase K, Molecular Biology Grade20 mg/mL6.25 µL
4AmericanBio Proteinase KLyophilized (add 50 mg per 1 mL of nuclease-free water) 2.5 µL

ABC
1VendorConcentrationVolume
2ThermoFisher Scientific MagMAX™ Viral/Pathogen Proteinase K50 mg/mL2.5 µL
3New England Biolabs Proteinase K, Molecular Biology Grade20 mg/mL6.25 µL
4AmericanBio Proteinase KLyophilized (add 50 mg per 1 mL of nuclease-free water) 2.5 µL

description:
The first section of this protocol details recommendations for collecting saliva for SARS-CoV-2 detection, either by self-collection or healthcare worker-assisted collection.
The second section details an extraction-free method for preparation of saliva samples for SARS-CoV-2 RNA detection. This involves the addition of proteinase K to reduce saliva viscosity, followed by a heating step to inactivate the proteinase K before RT-qPCR testing.
The third section describes a dualplex RT-qPCR assay for high-throughput SARS-CoV-2 diagnostics. The CDC_N1 (N1) primer/probe set targets the SARS-CoV-2 nucleocapsid gene, and is shown to be sensitive and specific. The human RNase P (RP) primer/probe set is included as an internal sample control - detection of RP at PCR cycle threshold (CT) <35 indicates that saliva of sufficient quantity and quality were tested. The combination of both N1 and RP in the dual-plex assay ensures that any negative SARS-CoV-2 PCR result occurred due to genuine absence of virus, and not because of invalid saliva collection or preparation.
Version 2 includes:
  • Optimized thermocycler conditions
  • Locally validated alternative options for Proteinase K, RT-qPCR master mix, and thermocyclers
  • Use of 8-strip tubes for sample processing step, due to contamination issues in 96-well plates.
